Yes, several cities have implemented measures successfully to maintain citizens' privacy and security in smart cities. Here are some examples:

1. Amsterdam, Netherlands: Amsterdam has implemented various measures to ensure data privacy, encryption, and transparency in collection, handling and management of smart city data. They have created an algorithmic integrity policy that ensures fairness and ethical use of algorithms in decision-making.

2. Barcelona, Spain: Barcelona's Smart City project aims to provide citizens with control over their personal data and make the data-driven system more transparent. They have implemented an open data portal, enabling citizens to access and reuse public data.

3. Seoul, South Korea: Seoul has implemented a system that uses artificial intelligence (AI) to detect illegal parking, manage city traffic and improve road safety. They use data anonymization procedures to ensure anonymity while managing data.

4. Singapore: Singapore has implemented an extensive set of privacy and data protection guidelines, under the Smart Nation initiative. Use of data in decision-making is transparent and ethical. They also launched the "Data Empowerment Programme" to enable citizens to access and use city data to better understand and solve community issues effectively.

These examples demonstrate that smart cities can succeed in maintaining citizen privacy and security through the implementation of effective data governance, stewardship practices, and ethical frameworks. By ensuring transparency, accountability, and respect for citizens' privacy rights and preferences, smart cities can create a better, more trusted, and desirable community environment.
